body: Hey @thomasvargiu, can you reproduce the issue on https://psalm.dev ?

rename.from: Wrong template infer with stubs and original docblock

body:
The problem isn't just on stubs:

Skipping the empty `Monad` interface and using `Applicative` directly it works as expected.
Removing param docblock from `Pointed` works as expected.

https://psalm.dev/r/72dd0c2084

issue.title: Conditional return on interface template doesn't work

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
Using a conditional return, behaviour is different when defined in interface or in a class.

With class docblock:
https://psalm.dev/r/3cc2367e01

Using interface docblock:
https://psalm.dev/r/4484822d18

I would expect that conditional return works when defined in interfaces too.

Another thing I noticed is that `(T is callable ? something : else)` doesn't work.

body:
@muglug Isn't resolved yet.

If `Pointed` has a a docblock, it doesn work: https://psalm.dev/r/40e629c932

It works:
- Removing docblock from `Pointed`: https://psalm.dev/r/948622b9f6
- Removing the `B` interface from the interface chain: https://psalm.dev/r/ff098b1e0a
Yeah, two inherited interfaces each with their own docblock confuses Psalm â€“ it's not immediately clear which docblock should take precedence.
So, should you open this issue again? Or are you working on it?
Sorry, I was being a bit lazy.
Problem is you can't always rely on that ordering â€“ `tests/ArrayAssignmentTest.php` was breaking in that scenario because there's something that re-adds a parent interface.
But thanks, I always appreciate PRs!

@muglug I think I found another issue about infer and inheritance:

https://psalm.dev/r/7f937bb1d0

Since `Foo::test()` returns `Foo`, which implements `B`, which implements `A`, the signature should be valid.
Instead Psalm requires that `Foo::test()` returns a type of `B`.
